page.title: 05Farming in S'key & C'thorpe.
page.content: {Mixed farming}is carried on throughout area: pasture in lowlands, crops with some rough grazing on downland, intensive turkey rearing on disused airfield; pheasants bred for shooting in coppices; sea-farming on shore. {Crops:}main crops are wheat, barley, sugar beet (introduced from Holland in 1920's. Initially, seasonal labour would cross from Holland and weed rows on knees); subsidiary crops are carrots, field beans, peas, some potatoes. No seed grass grown. {Livestock:}cattle for fattening and suckler herds, sheep for lambing, turkeys, some pheasant. {Sea-farming:}some cockle, lug-worm, mussel, samphire collection on coast.
